channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: New analysis on U.S. economy. And, MN prosecutors quit over DOJ probe into Good widow
item.description: Trump pitches affordability on a national tour to combat voter frustration. And, Minnesota federal prosecutors resign after DOJ pressure to probe Renee Macklin Good's widow.
item.content:encoded:
Trump pitches affordability on a national tour to combat voter frustration. And, Minnesota federal prosecutors resign after DOJ pressure to probe Renee Macklin Good's widow.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: The risks of AI in schools outweigh the benefits, report says
item.description: A new report warns that AI poses a serious threat to children's cognitive development and emotional well-being.
item.content:encoded: A new report warns that AI poses a serious threat to children's cognitive development and emotional well-being.
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: The death toll from a crackdown on protests in Iran jumps to over 2,500, activists say
item.description: The number of dead climbed to at least 2,571 early Wednesday, as reported by the U.S.-based Human Rights Activists News Agency, as Iranians made phone calls abroad for the first time in days.
item.content:encoded:
The number of dead climbed to at least 2,571 early Wednesday, as reported by the U.S.-based Human Rights Activists News Agency, as Iranians made phone calls abroad for the first time in days.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How have prices changed in a year? NPR checked 114 items at Walmart
item.description: We found the effects of tariffs and extreme weather, relief (finally!) in the egg cooler, plus one case of shrinkflation.
item.content:encoded: We found the effects of tariffs and extreme weather, relief (finally!) in the egg cooler, plus one case of shrinkflation.
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: How the feud between Trump and Minnesota is impacting the probe into the ICE shooting
item.description: The FBI is solely leading the inquiry into the killing of Renee Macklin Good by ICE agent Jonathan Ross without help from Minnesota authorities. Legal experts explain why the move is unusual and why joint investigations are the norm.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI is solely leading the inquiry into the killing of Renee Macklin Good by ICE agent Jonathan Ross without help from Minnesota authorities. Legal experts explain why the move is unusual and why joint investigations are the norm.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Unhoused women on Skid Row face dire health outcomes. This doctor wants to change that
item.description: Homeless women face unique health challenges with few dedicated resources. And as the number of women experiencing homelessness in Los Angeles continues to grow, Dr. Mary Marfisee hopes to bring them lifesaving resources.
item.content:encoded:
Homeless women face unique health challenges with few dedicated resources. And as the number of women experiencing homelessness in Los Angeles continues to grow, Dr. Mary Marfisee hopes to bring them lifesaving resources.

(Image credit: Zaydee Sanchez for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Romo

item.title: The story of 'synergy,' the word we love to hate
item.description: It's not just the quintessential corporate jargon word. "Synergy" goes back hundreds of years, with history in Christianity, medicine and psychology.
item.content:encoded:
It's not just the quintessential corporate jargon word. "Synergy" goes back hundreds of years, with history in Christianity, medicine and psychology.

(Image credit: Nadzeya Dzivakova)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: The long-term health impacts from the LA wildfires are just becoming clear
item.description: The fires affected millions of people in the region. It could take years to understand the health consequences, but ongoing research is helping to prepare people to weather the next fires more safely.
item.content:encoded:
The fires affected millions of people in the region. It could take years to understand the health consequences, but ongoing research is helping to prepare people to weather the next fires more safely.

(Image credit: Apu Gomes)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: NASA set to bring astronaut (and the rest of Crew-11) home early for medical reasons
item.description: In an unprecedented move, NASA is bringing an astronaut crew home early from the International Space Station because one astronaut has an undisclosed medical condition.
item.content:encoded:
In an unprecedented move, NASA is bringing an astronaut crew home early from the International Space Station because one astronaut has an undisclosed medical condition.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Young men want to get big. For some, it's becoming an obsession
item.description: Some teen boys are determined to grow more muscular to match their social media idols. Going to the gym and manipulating their diet can become compulsive — and dangerous.
item.content:encoded: Some teen boys are determined to grow more muscular to match their social media idols. Going to the gym and manipulating their diet can become compulsive — and dangerous.
item.dc:creator: Michal Ruprecht
